summary: The document is a declassified CIA report from 1962, detailing insights from a former member of the Directorio Revolucionario Estudiantil (DRE) in Santiago de Cuba. It covers the DRE's organizational structure, operational capabilities including possession of weapons and explosives, and interactions with other groups such as the Catholic student organization. The report also includes information on military installations and foreign instructors at the University of Oriente, alongside personal anecdotes about individuals in the Cuban government and military, reflecting their political orientations.
key_findings: The source, a former DRE member, organized 50 members into cells in Santiago de Cuba.
The DRE had operational capabilities, including access to weapons and explosives.
Efforts by the Catholic student organization to contact the DRE were noted, involving a blind person in these attempts.
Details on military installations in the Nicaro-Mayari Arriba area and the presence of foreign instructors at the University of Oriente were shared.
Personal stories highlighted interactions with Cuban government and military figures, revealing their political orientations.
